Most people aren’t against sustainable transport—they just find it harder.
People talk about their commute in terms of quality of life, not just cost or speed.
If we design systems better—trains, buses, bike infrastructure—people will naturally make better choices without needing constant moral pressure.
Until cities treat cyclists as full participants in the network, adoption will be uneven.
